newsitem.title: TURKEY: Second Turkish coalition deputy resigns.
newsitem.headline: Second Turkish coalition deputy resigns.

text.p: A Turkish MP from the secularist wing of Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan's Islamist-led coalition resigned, becoming the second deputy to quit the government on Friday.
Anatolian news agency said True Path Party deputy Hikmet Aydin quit but gave no reason for his resignation. Earlier, True Path MP Samil Ayrim stepped down in a row over Islamist activism.
The resignations leave the coalition with 278 MPs, a majority of only two in the 550-member parliament.
Intense pressure from the army for Erbakan to crack down on Islamist activists has opened up serious cracks in the 11-month-old coalition.
True Path leader Tansu Ciller, also the deputy prime minister, said on Friday that elections could solve the deepening government crisis.
Erbakan won an opposition censure motion this week by only half a dozen votes. He was helped by six MPs from a small right-wing party who backed the government.
